question: Can I increase my home loan amount if my annual income has increased to $80,000 and my credit score improved to 700?
true_answer: Yes, with increased income and improved credit score, you are eligible for a higher loan amount. Review the updated loan terms.

steps.description: Review updated income and credit score

loan_plan.current_objective: Assess eligibility for increased loan amount

steps.content: Can I increase my home loan amount if my annual income has increased to $80,000 and my credit score improved to 700?
Creating plan to assess loan increase: 1) Review updated income and credit score. 2) Compute new loan limits.
Decomposing task: income/credit review, compute limits, verify requirements.
Retrieving data on how income and credit score affect loan eligibility.
Higher income and improved credit score can increase loan limits.
Credit score of 700 is excellent, no issues found.
Calculating new loan limits based on updated information.
Calculated new loan limit is significantly higher.
Do I need additional documents for this increase?
Checking requirements for additional documentation when increasing loan.
Typically, no additional documents needed unless major changes in financials.
Review complete, updated loan eligibility is positive. Memory updated with new financials.
Updating loan plan and memory with new income and credit score.
Yes, with increased income and improved credit score, you are eligible for a higher loan amount. Review the updated loan terms.
